meanings.definition: An official or unofficial restriction or control on an activity or process.
meanings.sent1: The government's clampdown on illegal activities helped reduce crime rates.
meanings.sent2: The clampdown on social media usage during school hours was necessary for student focus.
meanings.sent3: The strict clampdown on candy consumption at the party left everyone craving sweets.
meanings.sent4: The clampdown on unauthorized access to the building was like a fortress protecting its treasure.
meanings.sent5: The clampdown on noise pollution made the neighborhood peaceful and quiet.

meanings.definition: To impose restrictions or controls on an activity or process.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to clampdown on excessive spending to improve financial stability.
meanings.sent2: Parents often clampdown on screen time to ensure their children have a healthy balance.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to clampdown on adding too much salt to the dish to avoid ruining the flavor.
meanings.sent4: The coach needed to clampdown on players arriving late to practice to maintain discipline.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to clampdown on cheating during exams to uphold academic integrity.
